'''Claudette Annette Rogers Robinson''' ({{n√©e}} '''Rogers'''; born June 20, 1942) is an American singer, best known as a member of the vocal group [[The Miracles]] from 1957 to 1972. Her brother Emerson "Sonny" Rogers was a founding member of the group, which before 1957 was named "The Matadors". Claudette replaced her brother in the group after he was drafted into the U.S. Army.

In 2012, Claudette was inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] with the rest of the original Miracles, including her cousin [[Bobby Rogers]], [[Warren "Pete" Moore|Pete Moore]], [[Ronnie White|Ronald White]], and [[Marv Tarplin]]. She was inducted alongside her former husband, Miracles lead singer [[Smokey Robinson]].
